channel.title: Wellness Spotlight
channel.itunes:author: Samony
channel.itunes:summary: Wellness Spotlight delivers trusted health and lifestyle insight. You get practical guidance on fitness, nutrition, mental strength, and daily habits. Each episode shares clear steps for better energy, focus, and balance. Topics cover exercise routines, food choices, stress control, sleep quality, and preventive care. Advice stays simple and evidence based. Wellness Spotlight fits adults seeking steady health improvement without noise. Follow Wellness Spotlight. Build healthier routines every day.
channel.itunes:keywords: nigeria, health strike, johesu, healthcare professionals, public health crisis, government demands, health, skin bleaching, dermatology, public health, embraceyourskin, beauty standards

item.title: Wellness Spotlight: Nigeria's Battle Against Outbreaks - 1,738 Lives Lost in 2025
item.description:
Join us on The Wellness Spotlight as we deep dive into the alarming statistics from Nigeria, where cholera, Lassa fever, measles, and diphtheria claimed 1,738 lives in 2025. We explore the causes, the critical response, and what this means for public health.
Hosts: Host: Benjamin (Co-Host), Co-Host: Funmi (Guest)
Category: Health
------------------------------------------- Follow Samony Podcast: Twitter: https://twitter.com/samony25 Instagram: https://instagram.com/samony25 Facebook: https://facebook.com/samony25 YouTube: https://youtube.com/@samony25 TikTok: https://tiktok.com/@samony25
Website: https://www.samony.com.ng Contact us: socials@samony.com.ng -------------------------------------------

item.title: The Wellness Spotlight: Rescuing Lives from Nigeria's 'Cash-and-Carry' Healthcare System
item.description:
This episode of The Wellness Spotlight dives deep into Nigeria's health insurance crisis. We explore the urgent calls from stakeholders to reform the 'cash-and-carry' system, aiming to save lives and ensure accessible healthcare for all Nigerians. Join us as we uncover solutions and debate the path forward.
Hosts: Host: Benjamin (Co-Host), Co-Host: Funmi (Guest)
Category: Health
------------------------------------------- Follow Samony Podcast: Twitter: https://twitter.com/samony25 Instagram: https://instagram.com/samony25 Facebook: https://facebook.com/samony25 YouTube: https://youtube.com/@samony25 TikTok: https://tiktok.com/@samony25

item.title: Nigeria's Silent Crisis: Unpacking Maternal Deaths and Fistula Epidemic
item.description:
An investigative look into Nigeria's alarming rates of obstetric fistula and maternal mortality, exploring the causes, societal impact, and potential solutions for a healthcare system on the brink.
Hosts: Host: Benjamin (Co-Host), Co-Host: Funmi (Guest)
Category: Health

item.title: Nigeria's Health Crisis: Workers Vow to Continue Indefinite Strike!
item.description:
Host SisterNkechi delivers a high-energy briefing on the ongoing health workers' strike in Nigeria, emphasizing the severe strain on the public health sector due to the indefinite strike by JOHESU and allied professionals. She highlights the unions' single priority condition, the disruption to medical operations, and calls for urgent government intervention to resolve the crisis affecting federal and state health facilities.
Hosts: Host: Sister Nkechi
Category: Health
------------------------------------------- Follow Samony Podcast: Twitter: https://twitter.com/samony25 Instagram: https://instagram.com/samony25 Facebook: https://facebook.com/samony25 YouTube: https://youtube.com/@samony25 TikTok: https://tiktok.com/@samony25
Website: https://www.samony.com.ng Contact us: socials@samony.com.ng -------------------------------------------

item.title: Unmasking the Crisis: Nigeria's Skin Bleaching Epidemic and the #EmbraceYourSkin Campaign
item.description:
Join Peter Johnson and Sister Nkechi as they delve into Nigeria's alarming skin-bleaching epidemic. They discuss the health risks, societal pressures, and the Nigerian Association of Dermatologists' new nationwide campaign, #EmbraceYourSkin, urging listeners to prioritize health and self-acceptance over harmful beauty standards.
Hosts: Host: Peter Johnson, Co-Host: Sister Nkechi
Category: Health
------------------------------------------- Follow Samony Podcast: Twitter: https://twitter.com/samony25 Instagram: https://instagram.com/samony25 Facebook: https://facebook.com/samony25 YouTube: https://youtube.com/@samony25 TikTok: https://tiktok.com/@samony25
Website: https://www.samony.com.ng Contact us: socials@samony.com.ng -------------------------------------------

item.title: Nigeria's Bold Pledge: Ending HIV/AIDS by 2030
item.description:
Nigeria has reaffirmed its commitment to eradicating HIV/AIDS as a public health threat before the 2030 global target. This episode delves into the reported progress on the UNAIDS 95-95-95 targets and the crucial role of expanded health insurance coverage for people living with HIV, examining both achievements and the challenges that remain.
Hosts: Host: Kingsley (Naija), Co-Host: Aisha (Radio)
Category: Health

item.title: Nigeria's 2030 Vision: Can We Truly Be HIV-Free?
item.description:
On World AIDS Day 2025, Nigeria's First Lady, Senator Oluremi Tinubu, urged national support for the goal of eradicating HIV/AIDS by 2030. This episode delves into the country's significant progress, including a 46% decline in new infections, while also dissecting the persistent challenges of funding gaps and societal stigma hindering this ambitious objective.
Hosts: Host: Charon, Co-Host: Tola (Slay Queen)
Category: Health

item.title: Nigeria's Recurring Health Crisis: Resident Doctors' 29-Day Strike and the Fragile Truce
item.description:
This episode delves into the recent 29-day indefinite strike by the Nigerian Association of Resident Doctors (NARD), exploring its causes, the demands of the doctors, and the impact on Nigeria's already strained healthcare system. We analyze the Memorandum of Understanding signed with the Federal Government, discussing whether this suspension is a genuine resolution or another temporary pause in a long-standing cycle of industrial action and unfulfilled promises.
Hosts: Host: HypeMan (Naija), Co-Host: Tola (Slay Queen)
Category: Health
